intro: Bomarea cornuta, commonly known as the horned bomarea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant features long, narrow leaves and produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers with a distinctive, horn-like structure at the base. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
